arts.ttl: Mark Robins says thanks to Stoke City faithful for what they did vs Watford
arts.sum: Mark Robins has issued a thank you to Stoke City supporters for the way they got behind the team against Watford on the back of a sorry mid-week defeat. I started him on the right side and he started to get involved a little bit but he was never going to be able to run back because of the illness he's had so I moved him into a position in the middle of the pitch and he gets a chance to win the game for us.

arts.ttl: Stoke and Watford draw blanks in uninspiring draw
arts.sum: Stoke and Watford played out a drab 0-0 Championship draw at the bet365 Stadium as neither side were able to give a boost to their respective end-of-season ambitions.
How the game at the Bet365 Stadium unfolded as two points slipped away in a pretty dreary encounter.

arts.ttl: Stoke and Watford draw blanks in uninspiring draw
arts.sum: There was little for fans to get excited about.

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Watford as frustrated and frustrating Potters held
arts.sum: In a 0-0 draw of few chances against Watford, Stoke were relieved when a back header from Ben Wilmot hit his own post during Watford’s best spell, building up a little bit of pressure going through the middle stages of the second half. Stoke finished stronger and Million Manhoef might have won it when he had a free shot just left of the penalty spot while Bae Junho had a header saved by Egil Selvik.

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs Watford as midfielder ill and striker returns in five changes
arts.sum: Stoke: Johansson, Tchamadeu Stevens, Phillips, Wilmot, Thompson, Pearson, Moran, Koumas, Junho, Al-Hamadi. Ben Pearson and Jordan Thompson are back in midfield, Lewis Koumas is back on the wing and Junior Tchamadeu returns at right-back as every department is shuffled.

arts.ttl: Stoke City vs Watford live - Team news from the bet365 Stadium - Stoke-on-Trent Live
arts.sum: I think tackling is a dying art now and people don’t necessarily do that but people can be in good positions to block and go and win things because they’re strong, they’re powerful, they knock people off the ball but they’re also capable tactically to be in the right position at the right time out of possession to be able to do that. What happens next will depend on the team but there must be little tricks to help make sure the atmosphere is positive, like sprinting, more urgent play or a big tackle.

arts.ttl: No regrets about move to Watford despite injury crisis – Feeling player was expendable
arts.sum: Watford signed goalkeeper Egil Selvik from Udinese in the January transfer window. He arrived on a permanent transfer and since joining he has played four times in the Championship and established himself as the Hornets’ first-choice between the sticks. He’s started the last four games for Tom Cleverley’s side. arts.ttl: Watford ‘in discussions’ with agent over buying 24-year-old – Player keen on permanent move to Hornets
arts.sum: Watford have a desire to sign Yasser Larouci on a permanent transfer, according to Africa Foot. Last season, ES Troyes AC let the left-back go out on loan at Sheffield United, who didn’t exercise the purchase option. He returned to England when the Hornets signed him on another loan deal last summer. arts.ttl: Stoke City fan, 83, fears being kicked out of bet365 Stadium seat
arts.sum: John Hall has a season ticket in the Franklyn Stand, has supported the club for 76 years, and relies on a lift pass which he was granted three years ago to get to his seat. An 83-year-old Stoke City fan fears being kicked out of his bet365 Stadium seat and having to cancel his season ticket - if he is banned from using a lift.
